intro: Nothopegia borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean nothopegia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Nothopegia borneensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its habitat.
